intro: Melampyrum pratense f. ovatum, commonly known as the ovate yellow larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in racemes, typical of the genus Melampyrum. This variant is distinguished by its ovate leaf shape, setting it apart from other forms within the species.
